title: Strange errors for send/transfer when using external functions between contracts

body:
@berar the problem is that `FeeProblemReceiver` doesn't have a [`receive`](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.6/contracts.html?highlight=receive#receive-ether-function) function. Adding one makes the test pass.

The way `send` and `transfer` differ is that the first one returns `false` on a failure (hence the log you see) and `transfer` reverts (that's the error in the test).

That being said, the error message in this particular scenario could be better. That is: if there's no data sent, we shouldn't include the `function selector was not recognized` part, since it's misleading. I think we can do better here. I'll open a new issue for that.

Thanks for the detailed code. If you have more questions, please use [our discord server](https://hardhat.org/discord).
In my case, the contract call the `externalContract.<functionXXX>`, and found out that the `<functionXXX>` does not exist. Shall we fix the error message? this might confuse many people.
